docs.snippet: It was a quiet cotton market yesterday, but prices held very steady in spite of the dullness. Liverpool was not quite as good as due, but the American markets are no longer following the English market and no attention was paid to the cables at the...
docs.lead_paragraph: It was a quiet cotton market yesterday, but prices held very steady in spite of the dullness. Liverpool was not quite as good as due, but the American markets are no longer following the English market and no attention was paid to the cables at the opening.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, June 22. -- Following his plan to continue the interest aroused for increased trade relations between North and South America by the recent Pan-American Financial Conference, William G. McAdoo, Secretary of the Treasury, announced today...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, June 22. -- Following his plan to continue the interest aroused for increased trade relations between North and South America by the recent Pan-American Financial Conference, William G. McAdoo, Secretary of the Treasury, announced today the personnel of the American members of the International High Commission on Uniform Legislation and of a committee to arrange for visits of American business men to Latin America.

docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, July 2. -- The large share of the United States in feeding the world during the European war was disclosed today in statistics of the Department of Commerce. Foodstuffs valued at $724,000,000 were exported during the eleven months ended May 31.

headline.main: WORLD IS BUYING AMERICA'S FOOD; The Exports in Eleven Months Ended May 31 Reached Record Total of $724,000,000. GREAT SHIFT IN MEAT TRADE Importations Are Much Heavier, but the Amounts Sent Abroad Are Swollen to Huge Figures.

docs.snippet: IT is sheer self-delusion to think that this war is only going to make victims. It will also make victors, and victors are likely to be bullies when they get their second wind. We must not forget that the spirit of Europe is very different from the...
docs.lead_paragraph: IT is sheer self-delusion to think that this war is only going to make victims. It will also make victors, and victors are likely to be bullies when they get their second wind. We must not forget that the spirit of Europe is very different from the spirit of America.

headline.main: PRESERVE U.S. FROM EUROPEANISM; We Ought Not Be Lured by the Glitter of World Influence, Says Dr. Orth of Cornell

byline.original: By Samuel P. Orth, Professor of Politics, Cornell University

docs.snippet: FALL RIVER, July 3. -- Trading in the print cloth markets of New England has been quiet all week. The sales are estimated at 135,000 pieces, an increase of about 40,000 pieces over last week. Of the total sales about 50,000 pieces were spots, the...
docs.lead_paragraph: FALL RIVER, July 3. -- Trading in the print cloth markets of New England has been quiet all week. The sales are estimated at 135,000 pieces, an increase of about 40,000 pieces over last week. Of the total sales about 50,000 pieces were spots, the rest being sold under contracts which will mature during the next three months.
